alternateName: Multi-modal Steam dataset: 239K games, semantic search, SQL database, 1M reviews

distribution.name: archive.zip
distribution.description: Archive containing all the contents of the Steam Dataset 2025: Multi-Modal Gaming Analytics dataset

distribution.name: application/pdf files
distribution.description: application/pdf files contained in archive.zip

distribution.name: application/json files
distribution.description: application/json files contained in archive.zip

distribution.name: application_categories.csv
distribution.description:
Junction table linking applications to Steam feature categories.

**Columns:**
- `appid` — Steam application ID  
- `category_id` — Category table key  

**Use Cases:** Feature adoption trends (e.g., achievements, controller support), cross-category overlap analysis.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8, ~12.4 MB)

distribution.name: application_developers.csv
distribution.description:
Junction table linking applications to developers (many-to-many).

**Columns:**
- `appid` — Steam application ID  
- `developer_id` — Developer table key  

**Use Cases:** Developer portfolio analysis, collaboration networks, productivity metrics.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8, ~3.4 MB)

distribution.name: application_genres.csv
distribution.description:
Junction table linking applications to genre classifications.

**Columns:**
- `appid` — Steam application ID  
- `genre_id` — Genre table key  

**Use Cases:** Genre co-occurrence analysis, content clustering, genre diversification studies.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8, ~6.5 MB)

distribution.name: application_platforms.csv
distribution.description:
Junction table linking applications to supported platforms.

**Columns:**
- `appid` — Steam application ID  
- `platform_id` — Platform table key  

**Use Cases:** OS compatibility analysis, Linux/macOS support trends, hardware adoption studies.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8, ~3.2 MB)

distribution.name: application_publishers.csv
distribution.description:
Junction table linking applications to publishers (many-to-many).

**Columns:**
- `appid` — Steam application ID  
- `publisher_id` — Publisher table key  

**Use Cases:** Publisher ecosystem mapping, publisher influence analysis.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8, ~3.0 MB)

distribution.name: applications.csv
distribution.description:
Primary table containing 239,664 Steam applications (games, DLC, software, and media).

**Key Columns:**
- `appid` — Steam application ID (primary key)  
- `name`, `type`, `is_free`, `release_date`  
- `mat_final_price`, `mat_currency`, `mat_discount_percent`  
- `mat_supports_windows`, `mat_supports_mac`, `mat_supports_linux`  
- `mat_achievement_count`, `mat_pc_memory_rec`, `mat_pc_graphics_rec`  

**Includes:** Materialized fields from `price_overview`, `achievements`, and `pc_requirements` JSONB.  
**Use Cases:** Market pricing analysis, genre-based segmentation, platform trends.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8, ~180 MB)

distribution.name: categories.csv
distribution.description:
Lookup table defining Steam store feature categories.

**Columns:**
- `category_id` — Category ID  
- `category_description` — Category name (e.g., Single-player, Co-op, Steam Cloud)  

**Use Cases:** Feature frequency analysis, gameplay mode segmentation.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8, ~12 KB)

distribution.name: developers.csv
distribution.description:
Lookup table of unique game developers.

**Columns:**
- `developer_id` — Primary key  
- `developer_name` — Developer name (company or individual)  

**Use Cases:** Developer network analysis, market share estimation, cross-publisher comparisons.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8, ~2.0 MB)

distribution.name: genres.csv
distribution.description:
Lookup table defining all recognized Steam genres.

**Columns:**
- `genre_id` — Genre ID  
- `genre_description` — Genre name (e.g., Action, Indie, RPG)  

**Use Cases:** Genre-based filtering, visualization, clustering.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8, ~2.4 KB)

distribution.name: platforms.csv
distribution.description:
Lookup table enumerating supported platforms.

**Columns:**
- `platform_id` — Auto-incrementing ID  
- `platform_name` — OS name (`windows`, `mac`, `linux`)  

**Use Cases:** Join reference for platform support tables.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8, 32 B)

distribution.name: publishers.csv
distribution.description:
Lookup table of unique publishers.

**Columns:**
- `publisher_id` — Primary key  
- `publisher_name` — Publisher name  

**Use Cases:** Publisher-level summaries, success metrics, and historical evolution studies.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8, ~1.8 MB)

distribution.name: reviews.csv
distribution.description:
Comprehensive corpus of 1,048,148 user reviews linked to Steam applications.

**Key Columns:**
- `recommendationid` — Unique review identifier (primary key)  
- `appid` — Foreign key to `applications`  
- `author_steamid`, `author_playtime_forever`  
- `review_text`, `voted_up`, `votes_up`, `votes_funny`, `weighted_vote_score`  
- `timestamp_created`, `timestamp_updated`  

**Use Cases:** Sentiment analysis, opinion mining, review behavior studies.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8, ~670 MB)

distribution.name: applications_embedding_map.csv
distribution.description:
Metadata for application embeddings with filtering attributes and array position mapping.

**Columns:**
- `app_id` (integer) - Steam application ID (primary key)
- `name` (string) - Application name
- `type` (string) - Application type (game, dlc, software, etc.)
- `is_free` (boolean) - Free-to-play status
- `release_date` (date) - Release date (YYYY-MM-DD format)
- `required_age` (integer) - Minimum age requirement (0-18)
- `metacritic_score` (integer) - Metacritic score (0-100, null if unavailable)
- `recommendations` (integer) - Total Steam recommendations count
- `embedding_index` (integer) - Row index in applications_embeddings.npy

**Usage:**
```python

distribution.name: reviews_embedding_map.csv
distribution.description:
Metadata for the review embeddings package. Each row maps a Steam review to its embedding row in reviews_embeddings.npy and includes minimal fields for analysis and joins.

Structure:

One row per embedded review

Row order aligns 1:1 with reviews_embeddings.npy by zero-based index

Key columns (subset):

recommendationid — Review ID (join key)

appid — Application ID (link to games)

index — row position in the .npy file

language, voted_up, votes_up, weighted_vote_score, timestamp_created (if present)

Joins & alignment:

Join on recommendationid to review text/metadata

Join on appid to application metadata

Join on index to vector rows in reviews_embeddings.npy

Loading:

import pandas as pd, numpy as np
meta = pd.read_csv('reviews_embeddings_metadata.csv')
emb  = np.load('reviews_embeddings.npy')                  # shape: (M, 1024)
df   = meta.join(pd.DataFrame(emb), how='inner')          # row-aligned by index


Use Cases:

Review clustering and topic exploration

Similar-review search and user preference modeling

Quality filters (e.g., helpfulness, language) before vector ops

Format: CSV (UTF-8)

distribution.name: 01_temporal_growth.csv
distribution.description:
Annualized summary of Steam catalog expansion from 1997–2025.

**Columns:**
- `year` — Calendar year of release  
- `total_apps` — Total applications released that year  
- `games`, `dlc`, `software`, `video`, `demo` — Per-type counts  
- `growth_rate` — Year-over-year percentage change  

**Use Cases:**
- Visualizing platform growth trajectory  
- Detecting major inflection periods (e.g., Steam Greenlight, Early Access)  
- Modeling historical release velocity  

**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

distribution.name: 02_genre_evolution.csv
distribution.description:
### 02_genre_evolution.csv
Yearly breakdown of genre prevalence and relative market share.

**Columns:**
- `year` — Calendar year of aggregation  
- `genre` — Steam genre name  
- `app_count` — Number of titles in this genre  
- `share_percent` — Percentage of total catalog that year  

**Use Cases:**
- Long-term evolution of player interest and developer focus  
- Comparative growth of genres such as Action, RPG, or Simulation  
- Cross-year visualization of genre diversification  

**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

distribution.name: 03_platform_support.csv
distribution.description:
# 03_platform_support.csv
Historical record of operating system support adoption across the Steam catalog.

**Columns:**
- `year` — Release year  
- `supports_windows` — Count of apps supporting Windows  
- `supports_mac` — Count of apps supporting macOS  
- `supports_linux` — Count of apps supporting Linux  
- `platform_share` — Normalized share of each platform  

**Use Cases:**
- Tracking Linux/macOS support trends  
- Estimating platform fragmentation  
- Analyzing cross-platform adoption curves  

**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

distribution.name: 04_pricing_strategy.csv
distribution.description:
# 04_pricing_strategy.csv
Pricing and discount metrics by release year and region-normalized pricing.

**Columns:**
- `year` — Calendar year  
- `avg_initial_price` — Mean initial price in USD (converted)  
- `avg_final_price` — Mean discounted price in USD  
- `avg_discount_percent` — Mean discount rate  
- `paid_ratio` — Share of non-free titles  

**Use Cases:**
- Inflation-adjusted pricing analysis  
- Evolution of discounting behavior on Steam  
- Market accessibility and free-to-play trends  

**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

distribution.name: 05_publisher_portfolios.csv
distribution.description:
### 05_publisher_portfolios.csv
Aggregated publisher-level metrics showing diversification and catalog expansion.

**Columns:**
- `publisher_name` — Publisher name  
- `year` — Reference year  
- `titles_released` — Titles launched that year  
- `cumulative_titles` — Total portfolio to date  
- `avg_price_usd` — Mean price of new releases  
- `unique_genres` — Number of distinct genres published  

**Use Cases:**
- Publisher portfolio strategy and growth  
- Competitive landscape analysis  
- Correlation between portfolio size and genre diversity  

**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

distribution.name: 06_achievement_evolution.csv
distribution.description:
### 06_achievement_evolution.csv
Tracks the growth and distribution of Steam achievement systems over time.

**Columns:**
- `year` — Release year  
- `games_with_achievements` — Count of games supporting achievements  
- `avg_achievement_count` — Mean number of achievements per game  
- `median_achievement_count` — Median number of achievements per game  

**Use Cases:**
- Measuring gamification adoption on Steam  
- Correlating achievements with game popularity  
- Feature diffusion analysis over time  

**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

distribution.name: 01_game_embeddings_sample.csv
distribution.description:
### **01_game_embeddings_sample.csv**
Sample subset of games used to generate and visualize embeddings.

**Columns:**
- `appid` — Steam application ID  
- `name` — Game title  
- `genre_primary` — Primary genre label  
- `combined_text` — Text used for embedding generation  

**Use Cases:** Quick preview of sample embeddings and genre composition.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

distribution.name: 02_embeddings_appids.csv
distribution.description:
### **02_embeddings_vectors.npy**
Compressed NumPy array containing 1024-dimensional BGE-M3 embeddings for the sampled games.

**Structure:**
- Shape: `(N, 1024)`  
- Dtype: `float32`  
- Order matches `02_embeddings_appids.csv` by index  

**Use Cases:** Vector similarity queries, UMAP/t-SNE visualization, clustering analysis.  
**Format:** NumPy `.npy`

distribution.name: 02_genre_representatives.csv
distribution.description:
### **02_genre_representatives.csv**
Representative games for each major genre used to benchmark semantic distances.

**Columns:**
- `genre` — Genre name  
- `appid` — Representative application ID  
- `name` — Representative game title  
- `embedding_index` — Corresponding row index in the `.npy` array  

**Use Cases:** Evaluate semantic coherence of genres, compute centroid vectors, or visualize genre clusters.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

distribution.name: 03-the-semantic-fingerprint-preview.csv
distribution.description:
# **03-the-semantic-fingerprint-preview.csv**
Lightweight CSV subset of the full semantic fingerprint dataset, optimized for Kaggle notebook execution.

**Columns (subset):**
- `appid` — Steam application ID  
- `name` — Game title  
- `genre_primary` — Target genre label  
- `token_count`, `char_count` — Linguistic feature metrics  
- `mat_final_price`, `mat_supports_windows`, `mat_supports_linux` — Materialized metadata fields  
- `embedding_index` — Vector row reference  

**Use Cases:** Quick training and testing of genre classifiers within notebook runtime limits.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

field.name: appid
field.description: Unique Steam application ID. Primary key for all application-level tables.

field.name: name
field.description: Official title of the Steam application.

field.name: type
field.description: Application type (game, dlc, demo, video, software, etc.).

field.name: is_free
field.description: Boolean flag indicating whether the application is free to play.

field.name: release_date
field.description: Official release date (YYYY-MM-DD).

field.name: required_age
field.description: Minimum age required to play (as reported by Steam).

field.name: short_description
field.description: Condensed summary text shown on the Steam store page.

field.name: supported_languages
field.description: Languages supported by the game (comma-separated list).

field.name: header_image
field.description: URL of the Steam header image.

field.name: background
field.description: URL of the store background image or trailer image asset.

field.name: metacritic_score
field.description: Metacritic aggregated score (0–100).

field.name: recommendations_total
field.description: Unique identifier for a user review (Steam API review ID).

field.name: mat_supports_windows
field.description: True if Windows platform is supported.

field.name: mat_supports_mac
field.description: True if macOS platform is supported.

field.name: mat_supports_linux
field.description: True if Linux platform is supported.

field.name: mat_initial_price
field.description: Original launch price in cents (extracted from `price_overview.initial`).

field.name: mat_final_price
field.description: Current or discounted price in cents (from `price_overview.final`).

field.name: mat_discount_percent
field.description: Discount percentage applied at the time of data collection.

field.name: mat_currency
field.description: ISO currency code for pricing (e.g., USD, EUR).

field.name: mat_achievement_count
field.description: Total number of Steam achievements for the application.

field.name: mat_pc_os_min
field.description: Minimum supported operating system (free-text parsed from “Minimum” requirements; e.g., “Windows 10 64-bit”).

field.name: mat_pc_processor_min
field.description: Minimum CPU model/string (e.g., “Intel i5-2500K” or equivalent)

field.name: mat_pc_memory_min
field.description: Minimum system RAM in **GB** (numeric when confidently parsed; otherwise parsed text).

field.name: mat_pc_graphics_min
field.description: Minimum GPU model/string (e.g., “GTX 960 / RX 470”).

field.name: mat_pc_os_rec
field.description: Recommended operating system (free-text parsed from “Recommended” requirements).

field.name: mat_pc_processor_rec
field.description: Recommended CPU model/string.

field.name: mat_pc_memory_rec
field.description: Recommended system RAM in **GB**.

field.name: mat_pc_graphics_rec
field.description: Recommended GPU model/string.

field.name: created_at
field.description: Timestamp when the record was first created.

field.name: updated_at
field.description: Timestamp when the record was last updated.

field.name: recommendationid
field.description: Unique identifier for a user review (Steam API review ID).

field.name: appid
field.description: Unique Steam application ID. Primary key for all application-level tables.

field.name: author_steamid
field.description: Unique user identifier of the reviewer.

field.name: author_num_reviews
field.description: Number of reviews the author has written on Steam.

field.name: author_playtime_forever
field.description: Total playtime of the reviewer (in minutes).

field.name: author_playtime_at_review
field.description: Playtime of the reviewer the last 2 weeks (in minutes).

field.name: author_last_played
field.description: Date the author last played a game on Steam.

field.name: language
field.description: SO language code of the review text (e.g., "english").

field.name: review_text
field.description: Full text of the review.

field.name: timestamp_created
field.description: Unix timestamp when the review was created.

field.name: timestamp_updated
field.description: Unix timestamp when the review was last updated.

field.name: voted_up
field.description: Boolean flag indicating if the review recommends the game.

field.name: votes_up
field.description: Number of users who marked the review as helpful.

field.name: votes_funny
field.description: Number of users who marked the review as funny.

field.name: weighted_vote_score
field.description: Steam-computed weight score balancing review helpfulness.

field.name: comment_count
field.description: Number of comments posted on the individual review thread. Useful as a proxy for community engagement or controversy.

field.name: steam_purchase
field.description: Boolean flag indicating whether the reviewer owns the game on Steam (True if the review was written for a legitimately purchased copy).

field.name: received_for_free
field.description: Boolean flag showing whether the user received the product for free (via key, beta, or developer promotion).

field.name: written_during_early_access
field.description: Boolean flag indicating if the review was written while the game was in Early Access.

field.name: created_at
field.description: Unix timestamp when the review was created.

field.name: updated_at
field.description: Unix timestamp when the review was last updated.

recordSet.name: reviews.csv

Comprehensive corpus of 1,048,148 user reviews linked to Steam applications.

**Key Columns:**

- `review_text`, `voted_up`, `votes_up`, `votes_funny`, `weighted_vote_score`  
- `timestamp_created`, `timestamp_updated`  

**Use Cases:** Sentiment analysis, opinion mining, review behavior studies.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8, ~670 MB)

- `supports_mac` — Count of apps supporting macOS  
- `supports_linux` — Count of apps supporting Linux  
- `platform_share` — Normalized share of each platform  

**Use Cases:**
- Tracking Linux/macOS support trends  
- Estimating platform fragmentation  
- Analyzing cross-platform adoption curves  

**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

recordSet.name: 04_pricing_strategy.csv
recordSet.description:
# 04_pricing_strategy.csv
Pricing and discount metrics by release year and region-normalized pricing.

**Columns:**
- `year` — Calendar year  
- `avg_initial_price` — Mean initial price in USD (converted)  
- `avg_final_price` — Mean discounted price in USD  
- `avg_discount_percent` — Mean discount rate  
- `paid_ratio` — Share of non-free titles  

**Use Cases:**
- Inflation-adjusted pricing analysis  
- Evolution of discounting behavior on Steam  
- Market accessibility and free-to-play trends  

**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

recordSet.name: 05_publisher_portfolios.csv
recordSet.description:
### 05_publisher_portfolios.csv
Aggregated publisher-level metrics showing diversification and catalog expansion.

**Columns:**
- `publisher_name` — Publisher name  
- `year` — Reference year  
- `titles_released` — Titles launched that year  
- `cumulative_titles` — Total portfolio to date  
- `avg_price_usd` — Mean price of new releases  
- `unique_genres` — Number of distinct genres published  

**Use Cases:**
- Publisher portfolio strategy and growth  
- Competitive landscape analysis  
- Correlation between portfolio size and genre diversity  

**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

recordSet.name: 06_achievement_evolution.csv
recordSet.description:
### 06_achievement_evolution.csv
Tracks the growth and distribution of Steam achievement systems over time.

**Columns:**
- `year` — Release year  
- `games_with_achievements` — Count of games supporting achievements  
- `avg_achievement_count` — Mean number of achievements per game  
- `median_achievement_count` — Median number of achievements per game  

**Use Cases:**
- Measuring gamification adoption on Steam  
- Correlating achievements with game popularity  
- Feature diffusion analysis over time  

**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

recordSet.name: 01_game_embeddings_sample.csv
recordSet.description:
### **01_game_embeddings_sample.csv**
Sample subset of games used to generate and visualize embeddings.

**Columns:**
- `appid` — Steam application ID  
- `name` — Game title  
- `genre_primary` — Primary genre label  
- `combined_text` — Text used for embedding generation  

**Use Cases:** Quick preview of sample embeddings and genre composition.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

recordSet.name: 02_embeddings_appids.csv
recordSet.description:
### **02_embeddings_vectors.npy**
Compressed NumPy array containing 1024-dimensional BGE-M3 embeddings for the sampled games.

**Structure:**
- Shape: `(N, 1024)`  
- Dtype: `float32`  
- Order matches `02_embeddings_appids.csv` by index  

**Use Cases:** Vector similarity queries, UMAP/t-SNE visualization, clustering analysis.  
**Format:** NumPy `.npy`

recordSet.name: 02_genre_representatives.csv
recordSet.description:
### **02_genre_representatives.csv**
Representative games for each major genre used to benchmark semantic distances.

**Columns:**
- `genre` — Genre name  
- `appid` — Representative application ID  
- `name` — Representative game title  
- `embedding_index` — Corresponding row index in the `.npy` array  

**Use Cases:** Evaluate semantic coherence of genres, compute centroid vectors, or visualize genre clusters.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

recordSet.name: 03-the-semantic-fingerprint-preview.csv
recordSet.description:
# **03-the-semantic-fingerprint-preview.csv**
Lightweight CSV subset of the full semantic fingerprint dataset, optimized for Kaggle notebook execution.

**Columns (subset):**
- `appid` — Steam application ID  
- `name` — Game title  
- `genre_primary` — Target genre label  
- `token_count`, `char_count` — Linguistic feature metrics  
- `mat_final_price`, `mat_supports_windows`, `mat_supports_linux` — Materialized metadata fields  
- `embedding_index` — Vector row reference  

**Use Cases:** Quick training and testing of genre classifiers within notebook runtime limits.  
**Format:** CSV (UTF-8)

keywords: subject > culture and humanities > games > video games
subject > science and technology > computer science
name: Steam Dataset 2025: Multi-Modal Gaming Analytics
description:
# Steam Dataset 2025: Multi-Modal Gaming Analytics Platform

**The first multi-modal Steam dataset with semantic search capabilities.** 
239,664 applications collected from official Steam Web APIs with PostgreSQL database architecture, vector embeddings for content discovery, and comprehensive review analytics.

Made by a lifelong gamer for the gamer in all of us. Enjoy!🎮

GitHub Repository  [https://github.com/vintagedon/steam-dataset-2025](url) 

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F28514182%2F4b7eb73ac0f2c3cc9f0d57f37321b38f%2FScreenshot%202025-10-18%20180450.png?generation=1760825194507387&alt=media)
*1024-dimensional game embeddings projected to 2D via UMAP reveal natural genre clustering in semantic space*

## What Makes This Different

Unlike traditional flat-file Steam datasets, this is built as an analytically-native database optimized for advanced data science workflows:

☑️ Semantic Search Ready - 1024-dimensional BGE-M3 embeddings enable content-based game discovery beyond keyword matching

☑️ Multi-Modal Architecture - PostgreSQL + JSONB + pgvector in unified database structure

☑️ Production Scale - 239K applications vs typical 6K-27K in existing datasets

☑️ Complete Review Corpus - 1,048,148 user reviews with sentiment and metadata

☑️ 28-Year Coverage - Platform evolution from 1997-2025

☑️ Publisher Networks - Developer and publisher relationship data for graph analysis

☑️ Complete Methodology & Infrastructure - Full work logs document every technical decision and challenge encountered, while my API collection scripts, database schemas, and processing pipelines enable you to update the dataset, fork it for customized analysis, learn from real-world data engineering workflows, or critique and improve the methodology

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F28514182%2F649e9f7f46c6ce213101d0948c89e8ac%2F4_price_distribution_by_top_10_genres.png?generation=1760824835918620&alt=media)
*Market segmentation and pricing strategy analysis across top 10 genres*

## What's Included

**Core Data (CSV Exports):**
- 239,664 Steam applications with complete metadata
- 1,048,148 user reviews with scores and statistics
- 13 normalized relational tables for pandas/SQL workflows
- Genre classifications, pricing history, platform support
- Hardware requirements (min/recommended specs)
- Developer and publisher portfolios

**Advanced Features (PostgreSQL):**
- Full database dump with optimized indexes
- JSONB storage preserving complete API responses
- Materialized columns for sub-second query performance
- Vector embeddings table (pgvector-ready)

**Documentation:**
- Complete data dictionary with field specifications
- Database schema documentation
- Collection methodology and validation reports

## Example Analysis: Published Notebooks (v1.0)

**Three comprehensive analysis notebooks demonstrate dataset capabilities.** All notebooks render directly on GitHub with full visualizations and output:

### 📊 Platform Evolution & Market Landscape
**[View on GitHub](https://github.com/vintagedon/steam-dataset-2025/blob/main/steam-dataset-2025-v1/notebooks/01-steam-platform-evolution-and-marketplace/notebook-01-steam-platform-evolution-and-market-landscape.ipynb)** | [PDF Export](https://github.com/vintagedon/steam-dataset-2025/blob/main/steam-dataset-2025-v1/notebooks/01-steam-platform-evolution-and-marketplace/notebook-01-steam-platform-evolution.pdf)  
28 years of Steam's growth, genre evolution, and pricing strategies.

### 🔍 Semantic Game Discovery
**[View on GitHub](https://github.com/vintagedon/steam-dataset-2025/blob/main/steam-dataset-2025-v1/notebooks/02-semantic-game-discovery/02-semantic-game-discovery.ipynb)** | [PDF Export](https://github.com/vintagedon/steam-dataset-2025/blob/main/steam-dataset-2025-v1/notebooks/02-semantic-game-discovery/notebook-02-semantic-game-discovery.pdf)  
Content-based recommendations using vector embeddings across genre boundaries.

### 🎯 The Semantic Fingerprint  
**[View on GitHub](https://github.com/vintagedon/steam-dataset-2025/blob/main/steam-dataset-2025-v1/notebooks/03-the-semantic-fingerprint/03-the-semantic-fingerprint.ipynb)** | [PDF Export](https://github.com/vintagedon/steam-dataset-2025/blob/main/steam-dataset-2025-v1/notebooks/03-the-semantic-fingerprint/notebook-03-the-semantic-fingerprint.pdf)  
Genre prediction from game descriptions - demonstrates text analysis capabilities.

**Notebooks render with full output on GitHub.** Kaggle-native versions planned for v1.1 release. CSV data exports included in dataset for immediate analysis.

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F28514182%2F4079e43559d0068af00a48e2c31f0f1d%2FScreenshot%202025-10-18%20180214.png?generation=1760824950649726&alt=media)
*Steam platform evolution: 28 years of release patterns and marketplace dynamics*

## Use Cases & Applications

**For Data Scientists:**
- Recommendation system development and testing
- NLP applications (sentiment analysis, review classification, description clustering)
- Time series analysis (pricing trends, release patterns, market evolution)
- Predictive modeling (genre classification, success prediction)

**For ML Engineers:**
- Vector embedding benchmarking and evaluation
- Multi-modal learning (text + metadata + structured data)
- Graph neural networks (publisher/developer relationship networks)
- Large-scale classification with class imbalance handling

**For Researchers:**
- Digital marketplace economics and pricing strategies
- Platform evolution and ecosystem dynamics
- User behavior analysis through review patterns
- Developer portfolio and collaboration network analysis

![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F28514182%2Fbbd9d6fd3c9cd39d1fafea24970fec04%2F7_developer_quality_vs_quantity_analysis.png?generation=1760824981721110&alt=media)
*Portfolio strategies: analyzing trade-offs between game volume and critical reception*

## Technical Specifications

**Collection Method:** Official Steam Web APIs only (no scraping or third-party services)  
**Collection Period:** August-September 2025  
**Success Rate:** 56% (134,000+ successful retrievals from 239K catalog)  
**Database:** PostgreSQL 16 with pgvector extension  
**Embeddings:** BGE-M3 model (1024 dimensions)  
**License:** CC BY 4.0  

## Data Quality & Transparency

All collection scripts, validation reports, and methodology documentation available in the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/vintagedon/steam-dataset-2025). Complete transparency in success rates, known limitations, and data validation processes.

**Known Limitations:**
- 56% API success rate due to delisted games and regional restrictions
- Review corpus limited to accessible public reviews
- Some historical pricing data may be incomplete
- Hardware requirements extracted from unstructured text (may have parsing edge cases)

## Citation

**Zenodo DOI:** [10.5281/zenodo.17286923](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.17286923)
